page.title: 04BIOGRAPHY
page.content: Biography of Mr David Leslie Watt, {Farmer,}aged 74. Mr Watt's family moved to Gobbs in 1923. Since leaving school at 14, he has worked on the 182 acre mixed farm - oats, barley, hay, turnips, 60-70 cattle with 5 cows, 2 pigs and hens for domestic use. Till the War there were 5 horses, with one man to work each horse. He rose at 5.30am to feed his horse; breakfasted at 6.30am; worked till lunch at 11am; worked from 1pm till 5.30pm or later; and fed his horse again at 8pm. The work was hard, but there was plenty of good food.(ref.page 18) In the bothy a friend played the melodion, and there were dances in the Arbuthnott Hall, and Inverbervie every Saturday, to which he walked or cycled. July saw the Arbuthnott Games, with throwing the Hammer etc.These activities died with the decline in population.
